inputs.name: rootDirectory
inputs.label: Root directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Base directory for searching files. If not specified the default working directory will be used.

inputs.name: targetFiles
inputs.label: Target files
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Absolute or relative comma or newline-separated paths to the files to replace tokens (wildcards can be used).
Syntax: {file path}[ => {output path}]
Example: 'web.config' will replace tokens in web.config and update the file.
Example: 'config\*.tokenized.config => *.config' will replace tokens in config\{filename}.tokenized.config and save the result in config\{filename}.config.

inputs.name: encoding
inputs.label: Files encoding
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Specify the files encoding.
The 'auto' value will determine the encoding based on the Byte Order Mark (BOM) if present; otherwise it will use ascii.

inputs.name: writeBOM
inputs.label: Write unicode BOM
inputs.helpMarkDown: If checked writes an unicode Byte Order Mark (BOM).
inputs.visibleRule: encoding != ascii && encoding != win1252 && encoding != iso88591

inputs.name: escapeType
inputs.label: Escape values type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify how to escape variable values.

inputs.name: escapeChar
inputs.label: Escape character
inputs.helpMarkDown: The escape character to use when escaping characters in the variable values.

inputs.name: charsToEscape
inputs.label: Characters to escape
inputs.helpMarkDown: Characters in variable values to escape before replacing tokens.

inputs.name: verbosity
inputs.label: Verbosity
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the logs verbosity level. (error and system debug are always on)

inputs.name: actionOnMissing
inputs.label: Action on missing variable
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the action on a missing variable.

inputs.name: keepToken
inputs.label: Keep token for missing variable
inputs.helpMarkDown: If checked tokens with missing variables will not be replaced by empty string.

inputs.name: actionOnNoFiles
inputs.label: Action on no file found
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the action when no file was found.

inputs.name: enableTransforms
inputs.label: Enable transformations
inputs.helpMarkDown:
If checked transformations can be applied on variable values.
Syntax: {token prefix}{transformation name}{transform prefix}{token}{transform suffix}{token suffix}
Example: #{lower(MyVar)}#

inputs.name: transformPrefix
inputs.label: Transform prefix
inputs.helpMarkDown: The prefix between transform name and token name.

inputs.name: transformSuffix
inputs.label: Transform suffix
inputs.helpMarkDown: The suffix after the token name.

inputs.name: variableFiles
inputs.label: Files (JSON or YAML)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Absolute or relative comma or newline-separated paths to the files containing additional variables (wildcards can be used). YAML files must have the .yml or .yaml extension otherwise the file is treated as JSON.

inputs.name: variableSeparator
inputs.label: Separator
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The separtor to use in variable names for nested objects in variable files.
Example: {'My':{'Value':'Hello World!'}} will create a variable 'My.Value' with the value 'Hello World!'

inputs.name: tokenPrefix
inputs.label: Token prefix
inputs.helpMarkDown: The prefix of the tokens to search in the target files.

inputs.name: tokenSuffix
inputs.label: Token suffix
inputs.helpMarkDown: The suffix of the tokens to search in the target files.

inputs.name: useLegacyPattern
inputs.label: Use legacy pattern
inputs.helpMarkDown: If checked whitespaces between the token prefix/suffix and the variable name are not ignored.

inputs.name: emptyValue
inputs.label: Empty value
inputs.helpMarkDown: The variable value which will be replaced by an empty string.

inputs.name: defaultValue
inputs.label: Default value
inputs.helpMarkDown: The value to be used if a variable is not found. Do not set to disable default value feature.

inputs.name: enableTelemetry
inputs.label: Send anonymous usage telemetry
inputs.helpMarkDown: If checked anonymous usage data will be sent to the task author for task usage analysis.
